oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Captain Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to "Kind Friends at Home"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Capt. Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA writes this letter from Big Spring, Virginia. He describes fishing for trout in the local streams. He also describes what winter clothing he needs including leather boots, jean; overcoat, lined trousers, woolen overshirts with two breast pockets, woolen undershirts, drawers and three pair of "coarse socks." He also mentions Capt. Feild, 1st Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA firing a Colt Revolving rifle at Federal pickets killing three.
